intro: Cheirodendron trigynum var. acuminatum, commonly known as the sharp-pointed cheirodendron, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its unique, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a small shrub or tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly toothed margin. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, often grouped into cyathia, which are typical of the Euphorbiaceae family.
